review_text: Boyfriend and I went on a staycation here and it was a wonderful experience! The apartment was easy to find and access. It was smaller than I expected, but still comfortable with great storage space. There were some great amenities like a blow dryer and desktop mirror, which were great for getting ready after I forgot my blowdryer. The bed was extremely comfortable and warm. The area is also one of my favorite in town, with Missy B’s right up the road and Westport around the corner; a great location for young out-of-towners! The only thing I was slightly irritated by and would say to keep in mind (which is a building thing, not a tenant issue) is the laundry unit uses tokens, not quarters, which can only be purchased from an in-wall coin machine that only takes $5, $10 and $20 bills. We had to run to the store to turn quarters into a $5, so make sure to have cash if you need to wash on-site.

I’ve been to KC more than a few dozen times and honestly Connor’s airbnb is phenomenal. The location in my opinion was fairly close to all the places I usually visit, the location was quiet and quaint. Checking in was easy and I had no trouble with anything while staying there. The fact that we were also able to bring our dog to the airbnb was also perfect. The accommodations for our dog was so sweet and thoughtful for an airbnb to even think about. On top of that, the backyard was very spacious and nice to sit out on when it’s not too cold. I loved the design and just the feel of the house, everything was so modern and boho yet minimal. The king size bed was also very comfortable and just has a very cuddly sense to it hahah. We unfortunately didn’t have anyone stay in the other bedroom but the bed looked just as comfortable as well! Literally, OBSESSED. There was also toiletries and extra towels for us to use in case we needed it, which i find it being rare. We did not have any issues with parking since the house has a long driveway. Connor was also easy to get ahold of and responded fairly quick. I’m 99.9% positive I will be staying here now whenever I come back to KC.
I would highly recommend staying here for anyone who is wanting to visit KC.

A few reviews mention the ceilings, which I had wondered about, so here's the scoop: this apartment is at the top of the house, which means nice character and great light (but good blinds, so don't worry about sleeping!), and also some angled ceilings because of the roofline. Importantly, the only person this affects is whoever sleeps on the far side (away from the bathroom) of the larger bedroom. This person (even if they aren't tall) will need to bend over to go around the foot of the bed and on their side - a bit awkward and if you get up a lot at night might be a problem. Nonetheless, so many good things about this place that you should definitely consider it!
